text:

html: I went down to Salisbury To listen to the choir, A pair of Russian tourists They were staring up the spire, Staring up the spire, they were, Silent and aghast, Against the sky, hurtling by, A piggy flying past.
text:
I went down to Salisbury 
To listen to the choir,
A pair of Russian tourists
They were staring up the spire,
Staring up the spire, they were,
Silent and aghast,
Against the sky, hurtling by,
A piggy flying past.

html: One year ago, in September 2017, Hurricanes Irma and Maria devastated large parts of the Caribbean. The UK government quickly responded with one of our largest-ever humanitarian operations. We continue to help people recover and stand ready to respond again if needed.pic.twitter.com/37SPOruVSF
text:
One year ago, in September 2017, Hurricanes Irma and Maria devastated large parts of the Caribbean.

The UK government quickly responded with one of our largest-ever humanitarian operations. We continue to help people recover and stand ready to respond again if needed.pic.twitter.com/37SPOruVSF

html: It's #WorldElephantDay today! #Poaching remains a serious threat to #elephants & we can not bring the dead ones back! At CITES #CoP17, over 100 nations called for #IvoryBan in countries implicated in illegal trade in #ivory. No one wants to live in a world without #elephants.pic.twitter.com/oAG29Yktev
text:
It's #WorldElephantDay today! #Poaching remains a serious threat to #elephants & we can not bring the dead ones back!

At CITES #CoP17, over 100 nations called for #IvoryBan in countries implicated in illegal trade in #ivory. No one wants to live in a world without #elephants.pic.twitter.com/oAG29Yktev

html: We're working closely with UK Border Force to help stop the illegal #ivory trade into and out of the UK. Between January and September last year they made 662 seizures of endangered plant and animal specimens. #WorldElephantDaypic.twitter.com/zyXuNpKhX5

html: Just had special call from the UK Minister for Africa, @hbaldwin. We had a great conversation regarding political developments in Zimbabwe.I’m encouraged by the UK government’s insistence on standards for human rights, credible elections and rule of law.
text: Just had special call from the UK Minister for Africa, @hbaldwin. We had a great conversation regarding political developments in Zimbabwe.I’m encouraged by the UK government’s insistence on standards for human rights, credible elections and rule of law.

html: I spoke to @nelsonchamisa and @MinisterSBMoyo today, urging all parties in #Zimbabwe to call for calm while challenges to the election result are considered. #UK extremely concerned by violence & human rights violations. We call for Zimbabwe security forces to act with restraint.

html: Historic day for Horn of Africa as bitter foes Ethiopia and Eritrea agree to normalise ties, with opening of embassies, free travel of people, airline links and use of Eritrea's ports for this landlocked nation which currently pushes 90pct of its trade through Djibouti.
text: Historic day for Horn of Africa as bitter foes Ethiopia and Eritrea agree to normalise ties, with opening of embassies, free travel of people, airline links and use of Eritrea's ports for this landlocked nation which currently pushes 90pct of its trade through Djibouti.
